thread.title: Trip of the week: A Passage to British Honduras
thread.title_full: Trip of the week: A Passage to British Honduras

title: Trip of the week: A Passage to British Honduras
text:
By Cindy Decker Dispatch • Sunday August 16, 2015 5:00 AM 
Each week, Travel Editor Cindy Decker highlights an interesting travel package sent to her inbox. 
A Passage to British Honduras 
UNCOMMON JOURNEYS, 1-800-323-5893 
THE TRIP: The 12-day excursion, set for Dec. 3-14, begins in Chicago, where guests board one of the nation’s finest vintage trains: Pullman Rail Journeys’ “Panama Limited” overnight service to New Orleans. 
Guests spend two nights in the French Quarter, sightseeing included, before boarding Norwegian Cruise Line’s Norwegian Dawn bound for Belize, the former British Honduras. There, passengers will find the second-longest barrier reef in the world; lush jungles filled with jaguars, ocelots and monkeys; and breathtaking Maya ruins. In addition to Belize City, other ports of call include Costa Maya, Roatan and Cozumel. 
Another overnight train trip returns guests from New Orleans to Chicago. 
THE COST: from $2,895 per person, double occupancy
